CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 10, 1953, page 29, reads: "Extra Sales Push... was given the Lucky Strike Cigarette advertising campaign in the courier when special posters were distributed throughout the nation calling special attention to the current attractive ads featured in this publication. The national campaign is of particular interest as it ties in with the World Series and features endorsements of leading Dodger ball stars. Pictured above, commenting on the Lucky Strike display, are, left to right: Walter Jones, Pittsburgh Lucky representative; William Goode, owner of Goode Pharmacies; Clyde Page, Courier promotion manager, and John Edghill, Lucky Strike sales supervisor for the Eastern Seaboard area. - Harris Photo."Goode Pharmacy (William W. Goode, owner) was located at 1303 Wylie Avenue. William Goode took over the business from Jennings and Brown, black pharmacists in the Hill District since 1907.  Roy Campanella played catcher for the Brooklyn Dodgers baseball team from 1948 to 1957.  The poster also mentions players Joe Black and Junior Gilliam, who joined the Dodgers in 1953.  The players are featured here in an advertisement for Lucky Strike cigarettes addressed to Dodger fans.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Walt Jones, Pharmacist William W. Goode, Jim Goode or possibly Clyde Page, and Clyde Page or possibly John Edghill, standing at counter in Goode Pharmacy with advertisement for Lucky Strike cigarettes listing Roy Campanella, Joe Black, and Junior Gilliam
